title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 13.7 - Approval of use of name or title
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 13.7 - Approval of use of name or title

State Regulations

The right to use, advertise or transact business under the
name or title "university," "college," "school of law," "school of medicine,"
"school of dentistry," "school of pharmacy," "school of veterinary medicine,"
"school of nursing," "school of optometry," "school of podiatry," "school of
chiropody," "school of architecture," "school of engineering," "school of
opthamalic dispensing," "school of physiotherapy," "junior college," "community
college," shall be granted only to such individuals, copartnerships, associations or corporations as satisfactorily meet the requirements prescribed
by the department for the registration of a university, college, school of law, school of medicine, school of dentistry, school of pharmacy, school of
veterinary medicine, school of nursing, school of optometry, school of
podiatry, school of chiropody, school of architecture, school of engineering, school of ophthalmic dispensing, school of physiotherapy, junior college, or
community college, respectively. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
13.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
